data.title: 以 3 到 5 分钟描写以下主题
data.content: Describe what you think would happen if you could only buy products made in your country. What would be the most difficult things to live without? How would people's lives change?
data.answer: If I could only buy things that are made in Australia, I believe that I would have to spend a lot more money. Because China provides the largest labor market and thus the largest cost-effective production market. Compared to products that are made in China, Australian products are much more expensive. I believe the main reason is the high labor cost. I think the most difficult things to live without would be some daily necessities, such as toothbrushes or drinking cups. If I continue to use a toothbrush that is made in China, I might still be able to replace it every month because of its cheap price. But if I purchase Australian-made toothbrushes regularly, I might have to wait a longer period of time to save enough money so that I can replace a new one.
